titleStmt.title: A ship-load of waggery. Or, clouded merriment to please young men and maids. Maidens, here's long, and strong, both great and small; for one poor penny you may purchase all. To a new tune. Or Cloris awake.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for P[hilip]. Brooksby at the golden Ball in West Smithfield.,

notesStmt.note: Verse: "A ship must have a steers-man ..."
Date, place of publication and publisher's name from Wing.
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library.

place.placeName: the golden Ball in West Smithfield.
